title: Creating MAMS from AnnData
text: Matrix Analysis Metadata Standards (MAMS) can used capture relevant information data matrices annotations produced common complex analysis workflows single-cell data. workflow highlights RNA expression based experiment AnnData object can annotated using rmams package. purpose, utilize pre-processed PBMC3K AnnData object, passed standard python scanpy workflow. data object (scverse-getting-started-anndata-pbmc3k_processed.h5ad) available link [1]. workflow focused producing data/results commonly generated real-world analyses can annotated MAMS. information MAMS, see GitHub repository

previous_headings: Introduction
title: Creating MAMS from AnnData
code: library(reticulate) library(anndata) adata <- anndata::read_h5ad('../inst/extdata/pbmc3k_annData_processed.h5ad')

previous_headings: Introduction
what: Step 2: Creating the MAMS object from the AnnData object
title: Creating MAMS from AnnData
code: library(rmams)  # get the file paths of anndata objects file_paths <- c('../inst/extdata/pbmc3k_annData_processed.h5ad')  # get the names of these objects  file_names <-  gsub(pattern = "\\.rds$", replacement = "", x = basename(file_paths))  # save the anndata objects onto the object_list by reading the object from file path. object_list <- lapply(file_paths, read_h5ad)  # name the list objects using previously generated file_names. names(object_list) <- file_names  # define the type of each subset observational_subsets<-c("nonartifact") datasetid = "PBMC3K"

previous_headings: Introduction > Step 2: Creating the MAMS object from the AnnData object
title: Creating MAMS from AnnData
code: result <- convert_AnnData_to_MAMS(     object_list = object_list,      observation_subsets = observational_subsets,      X_processing = c("logcounts"),      dataset_id = datasetid)

title: Creating MAMS from SingleCellExperiment
text: Matrix Analysis Metadata Standards (MAMS) can used capture relevant information data matrices annotations produced common complex analysis workflows single-cell data. workflow highlights RNA expression based experiment SingleCellExperiment object can annotated using rmams package. purpose, analyze PBMC 1K dataset using packages Bioconductor SingleCellExperiment data-container. steps include: - Importing raw/droplet filtered/cell matrices - Performing quality control subsetting filtered matrix include high-quality cells - Clustering cells - Clustering T-cells workflow demonstrates different subsets cells/observations produced due QC/filtering can made based different biological subsets. Note goal workflow less producing best clustering results cell type characterization. Rather focused producing data/results commonly generated real-world analyses can annotated MAMS. information MAMS, see GitHub repository

previous_headings: Introduction > Step 1: Creating the SingleCellExperiment object
title: Creating MAMS from SingleCellExperiment
text: first import required packages R environment:
code: library(dplyr) library(SingleCellExperiment) library(DropletUtils) library(scater) library(scran) library(patchwork) library(AnnotationDbi) library(org.Hs.eg.db)

previous_headings: Introduction > Step 1: Creating the SingleCellExperiment object
title: Creating MAMS from SingleCellExperiment
code: sce.raw <- read10xCounts("../data/raw_feature_bc_matrix/") sce.filtered <- read10xCounts("../data/filtered_feature_bc_matrix")  ensembl_ids <- rownames(sce.filtered) gene_symbols <- mapIds(org.Hs.eg.db, keys = ensembl_ids, column = "SYMBOL", keytype = "ENSEMBL", multiVals = "first") #> 'select()' returned 1:many mapping between keys and columns rownames(sce.filtered) <- ifelse(is.na(gene_symbols), ensembl_ids, gene_symbols)

previous_headings: Introduction > Step 1: Creating the SingleCellExperiment object
title: Creating MAMS from SingleCellExperiment
text: filtered matrix subset based quality control metrics mitchondrial percentage:
code: is.mito <- grep("mt-", rownames(sce.filtered)) sce.filtered.nonartifact <- quickPerCellQC(sce.filtered, subsets=list(Mito=is.mito), sub.fields="subsets_Mito_percent")

previous_headings: Introduction > Step 1: Creating the SingleCellExperiment object
title: Creating MAMS from SingleCellExperiment
text: goal many single cell workflows perform clustering identify biologically relevant groups cells, perform clustering cells passed QC metrics previously:
code: sce.filtered.nonartifact <- logNormCounts(sce.filtered.nonartifact) dec <- scran::modelGeneVar(sce.filtered.nonartifact) hvgs <- scran::getTopHVGs(dec, n = 2000) sce.filtered.nonartifact <- scater::runPCA(sce.filtered.nonartifact, subset_row = hvgs) g <- scran::buildSNNGraph(sce.filtered.nonartifact, use.dimred = "PCA") clusters <- igraph::cluster_louvain(g)$membership colLabels(sce.filtered.nonartifact) <- factor(clusters) sce.filtered.nonartifact <- scater::runUMAP(sce.filtered.nonartifact, dimred = "PCA") plotUMAP(sce.filtered.nonartifact, colour_by = "label") plotUMAP(sce.filtered.nonartifact, colour_by = "CD3E", by_exprs_values = "logcounts")

previous_headings: Introduction > Step 1: Creating the SingleCellExperiment object
title: Creating MAMS from SingleCellExperiment
text: Now subset just T-cells re-clustering subset:
code: sce.tcell <- sce.filtered.nonartifact[, sce.filtered.nonartifact$label %in% c(1,3,5,6,9)]

previous_headings: Introduction > Step 1: Creating the SingleCellExperiment object
title: Creating MAMS from SingleCellExperiment
code: sce.tcell <- logNormCounts(sce.tcell) dec <- modelGeneVar(sce.tcell) hvgs <- getTopHVGs(dec, n = 2000) sce.tcell <- runPCA(sce.tcell, subset_row = hvgs) g <- buildSNNGraph(sce.tcell, use.dimred = "PCA") clusters <- igraph::cluster_louvain(g)$membership colLabels(sce.tcell) <- factor(clusters) sce.tcell <- runUMAP(sce.tcell, dimred = "PCA") plotUMAP(sce.tcell, colour_by = "label")

previous_headings: Introduction > Step 1: Creating the SingleCellExperiment object
title: Creating MAMS from SingleCellExperiment
code: saveRDS(sce.raw, "../inst/extdata/pbmc1k_sce_raw.rds") saveRDS(sce.filtered, "../inst/extdata/pbmc1k_sce_filtered.rds") saveRDS(sce.filtered.nonartifact, "../inst/extdata/pbmc1k_sce_filtered_nonartifact.rds") saveRDS(sce.tcell, "../inst/extdata/pbmc1k_sce_tcell.rds")

previous_headings: Introduction > Step 2: Creating the MAMS object from the SingleCellExperiment object
title: Creating MAMS from SingleCellExperiment
code: library(rmams)  # get the file paths of sce objects  file_paths <- c("../inst/extdata/pbmc1k_sce_raw.rds", "../inst/extdata/pbmc1k_sce_filtered.rds", "../inst/extdata/pbmc1k_sce_filtered_nonartifact.rds", "../inst/extdata/pbmc1k_sce_tcell.rds")  # get the names of these objects  file_names <-  gsub(pattern = "\\.rds$", replacement = "", x = basename(file_paths))  # save the seurat objects onto the object_list by reading the object from file path. object_list <- lapply(file_paths, readRDS)  # name the list objects using previously generated file_names. names(object_list) <- file_names  # define the type of each subset observational_subsets<-c("raw", "filtered","nonartifact","subset") datasetid = "PBMC1K"

title: Creating MAMS from Seurat
text: Matrix Analysis Metadata Standards (MAMS) can used capture relevant information data matrices annotations produced common complex analysis workflows single-cell data. use case demonstrates MAMS can used annotate matrices annotations produced analysis multi-modal single-cell data containing RNA Antibody Derived Tags (ADTs). analyze PBMC 1K dataset Seurat package according Multi-modal Weighted Nearst Neighbor vignettes. analytical steps include: Importing raw/droplet filtered/cell matrices Performing quality control subsetting filtered matrix include high-quality cells Clustering cells RNA Clustering cells ADTs Clustering cells RNA ADT Clustering T-cells RNA Clustering T-cells ADT Clustering T-cells RNA ADT workflow demonstrates different subsets cells/observations produced due QC/filtering can made based different biological subsets. also produces several matrices annotations different modalities. Note goal workflow less producing best clustering results cell type characterization. Rather focused producing data/results commonly generated real-world analyses can annotated MAMS. information MAMS, see GitHub repository

previous_headings: Introduction > Step 1: Creating the Seurat object
title: Creating MAMS from Seurat
code: library(dplyr) library(Seurat) library(patchwork) raw.matrices <- Read10X(data.dir = "../data/raw_feature_bc_matrix/") #> 10X data contains more than one type and is being returned as a list containing matrices of each type. data.raw <- CreateSeuratObject(counts = raw.matrices[[1]], assay = "RNA", project = "pbmc1k") adt <- CreateAssayObject(counts = raw.matrices[[2]]) data.raw[["ADT"]] <- adt  nonempty.matrices <- Read10X(data.dir = "../data/filtered_feature_bc_matrix") #> 10X data contains more than one type and is being returned as a list containing matrices of each type. data.nonartifact <- CreateSeuratObject(counts = nonempty.matrices[[1]], assay = "RNA", project = "pbmc1k") adt <- CreateAssayObject(counts = nonempty.matrices[[2]]) data.nonartifact[["ADT"]] <- adt

code: DefaultAssay(data) <- 'RNA' data <- NormalizeData(data) %>% FindVariableFeatures() %>% ScaleData() %>% RunPCA() data <- FindNeighbors(data, dims = 1:10) data <- FindClusters(data, resolution = 2, verbose = FALSE) data <- RunUMAP(data, reduction = 'pca', dims = 1:10, assay = 'RNA',                reduction.name = 'rna.umap', reduction.key = 'rnaUMAP_') DimPlot(data, reduction = 'rna.umap')

code: DefaultAssay(data) <- 'ADT' VariableFeatures(data) <- rownames(data[["ADT"]]) data <- NormalizeData(data, normalization.method = 'CLR', margin = 2) %>%    ScaleData() %>% RunPCA(reduction.name = 'apca', dims = 1:10) data <- FindNeighbors(data, reduction = "apca", dims = 1:10) data <- FindClusters(data, graph.name = "ADT_snn", resolution = 2, verbose = FALSE) data <- RunUMAP(data, reduction = 'apca', dims = 1:10,                reduction.name = 'adt.umap', reduction.key = 'adtUMAP_') DimPlot(data, reduction = 'adt.umap')

previous_headings: Introduction > Step 2: Creating the MAMS object from seurat object
title: Creating MAMS from Seurat
code: library(rmams)  # get the file paths of seurat objects  file_paths <- c("../inst/extdata/pbmc1k_seurat_filtered.rds", "../inst/extdata/pbmc1k_seurat_nonartifact.rds", "../inst/extdata/pbmc1k_seurat_tcell.rds")  # get the names of these objects  file_names <-  gsub(pattern = "\\.rds$", replacement = "", x = basename(file_paths))  # save the seurat objects onto the object_list by reading the object from file path. object_list <- lapply(file_paths, readRDS)  # name the list objects using previously generated file_names. names(object_list) <- file_names  # define the type of each subset observational_subsets<-c("filtered","nonartifact","subset") datasetid = "PBMC1K"

previous_headings: Introduction > Support for Seurat V5 objects
what: In this example we show how we can extract counts from Seurat V5 object and make a V3 object that can be used with rmams pacakge
title: Creating MAMS from Seurat
code: options(Seurat.object.assay.version = "v5")   pbmc.counts <- Read10X(data.dir = "../data/filtered_feature_bc_matrix/") pbmc <- CreateSeuratObject(counts = pbmc.counts) class(pbmc[["RNA"]]) #> [1] "Assay5" #> attr(,"package") #> [1] "SeuratObject"  # Extract counts from v5 v3_counts = LayerData(pbmc, assay="RNA", layer='counts')  # make v3 object   options(Seurat.object.assay.version = "v3") pbmc_v3 <- CreateSeuratObject(counts = v3_counts) class(pbmc_v3[["RNA"]]) #> [1] "Assay" #> attr(,"package") #> [1] "SeuratObject"  # This pbmc_v3 can now be used with rmams pacakge

Although wide range experimental protocols platforms available, important commonality across technologies often produce matrix features measured set observations. order facilitate data sharing across groups technologies, assays, promote interoperability -stream analysis tools, detailed data schema describing characteristics FOMs developed serve standard useful community.

title: R Matrix and Analysis Metadata Standards
text: can access detailed tutorial use rmams package .
code: library(Seurat) options(Seurat.object.assay.version = "v3") counts <- matrix(rpois((500*200), 1), nrow = 500, ncol = 200, dimnames = list(paste0("Row", 1:500), paste0("Col", 1:200))) srt <- CreateSeuratObject(counts = counts) srt <- NormalizeData(srt) subset_srt <- srt[, 1:100] mams <- convert_seurat_to_MAMS(object_list = list(srt = srt, subset_srt = subset_srt),   observation_subsets = c("full", "subset"), dataset_id = "dataset1") print(mams)

title: Converts a AnnData object to a MAMS object â convert_AnnData_to_MAMS

One : full, filtered, threshold, detected, nonartifact, clean. dataset_id Specify id dataset

title: Converts a AnnData object to a MAMS object â convert_AnnData_to_MAMS
text: MAMS object containing extracted metadata fields.

title: Converts a AnnData object to a MAMS object â convert_AnnData_to_MAMS
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(reticulate) anndata <- import("anndata") counts <- matrix(rpois((500*200), 1), nrow = 500, ncol = 200,      dimnames = list(paste0("Row", 1:500), paste0("Col", 1:200))) adata <- anndata$AnnData(X = counts) py_set_item(adata$obsm, 'X_pca', matrix(rnorm(50), nrow=500, ncol=10)) py_set_item(adata$obsm, 'X_tsne', matrix(rnorm(50), nrow=500, ncol=2)) mams <- convert_AnnData_to_MAMS(object_list = list(adata = adata),      observation_subsets = c("full"), dataset_id = "dataset1") print(mams) } # }

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(SingleCellExperiment) counts <- matrix(rpois((500*200), 1), nrow = 500, ncol = 200,      dimnames = list(paste0("Row", 1:500), paste0("Col", 1:200))) sce <- SingleCellExperiment(list(counts=counts)) sce <- scuttle::logNormCounts(sce) subset_sce <- sce[, 1:100] mams <- convert_SCE_to_MAMS(object_list = list(sce = sce,      subset_sce = subset_sce), observation_subsets = c("full", "subset"),      dataset_id = "dataset1") print(mams) } # }
